Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the increase in tax revenue collected by Kenya Revenue Authority from KSh600 billion to KSh1.3 trillion.
Understate: There is no indication of any understatement bias in the provided claim.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks specific evidence or data to support the stated percentages of tax revenue and development spend.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the increase in tax revenue and the percentage of the national budget spent on development are directly linked without providing sufficient evidence or explanation.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no alternative explanation presented in the provided claim.
